Blog.post: urlLink Was very lucky to get this shot of Brodie. He only sat for two shots before he'd had enough. urlLink
urlLink This image was taken with a pocket digital camera. I gave it some impact by making the rock and smaller leaf black and white. urlLink

urlLink A friend asked me to take a few shots of her cat. It's interesting to see the reaction when people see this image. This image has won best of show, member's choice and a second place finish in three different competitions. urlLink

urlLink This shot was also taken during "Doors Open", Toronto. This lady walked to the railing on the second floor and I snapped a few shots of her. Her wardrobe and posing really worked in the shots. urlLink
urlLink Took this portrait as a lighting check for a model shoot. urlLink
urlLink This too is a shot taken with my studio lights hot wired to a pocket digital camera. urlLink
urlLink Having some fun in the studio and editing the image on the computer gave me this. This image always gets a laugh when it's on display. urlLink
urlLink This image came about as a result of trying to figure out a way to hook up my studio lights with a pocket digital camera. urlLink
urlLink The Golden Bear, Jack Nicklaus, Hitting his Tee shot on 165 yards par 3 third hole during the Canadian Open. One of the few events he never won. urlLink
urlLink Tiger Woods has made two appearances at the Canadian Open. Missed the cut on his first visit and won it on his second visit. urlLink
urlLink This shot of Payne Stewart was taken at the Canadian Open just months before his death. urlLink
urlLink Took this one night on Clifton Hill. The hill is full of museums and other tourist attractions in Niagara Falls. urlLink

urlLink This was taken on very hot July 1st during the firefighters challenge in Niagara Falls. The challenge involves several events and the firefighters have to do the entire challenge in full gear. urlLink
urlLink This was taken at the Bluejays/Dodgers game. Didn't take long for the Dodgers to get started this base was stolen in the first inning. urlLink
urlLink MMMMMMMMMMMMM, Dessert anyone? urlLink
urlLink Was fooling around in the studio one day and after a bit of photo editing came up with this. urlLink
urlLink This was taken during the "Doors Open",Toronto, an annual one or two day event that allows visitors into locations that are normally closed to the public. urlLink
urlLink This image was taken in a out door rose garden on an overcast day. At f/2.8 I was able to get the edges of the rose very soft. urlLink
urlLink These were anchored just off the pier. Don't think it would be the same without the clouds. urlLink
urlLink Although one of the best spots in Ontario for sunsets rarely do you get the sun setting on the horizon like this. urlLink
urlLink I spent about an hour in Port Delhousie shooting, with the two piers it is easy to get shots like this. urlLink
urlLink Port Delhousie, One of the best spots in Ontario to photograph sunsets. urlLink

urlLink This is a classic example of being in the right spot at the right time. Took this about 10 years ago in Port Delhousie. One of the few times the sun set on the horizon without any clouds. I watched and waited hoping the boat would get in front of the sun before it set completely. This shot was taken with a 500mm mirror lens with a 2X converter attached. urlLink
